experiment.name: Transcription profiling of Arabidopsis thaliana LFY mutant plants transformed with different LFY orthologs to investigate evolutionary divergence of LFY function

description.text:
The aim of this experiment is to test the ability of the ortholog of Arabidopsis LFY gene from flowering and non flowering species to complement an Arabidopsis LFY mutant.

Plants expressing, in a homozygous lfy12 background, the open reading frame of LFY orthologs under the control of Arabidopsis LFY promoter were synchronously induced to flower by growing plants in short days for 30 days then shifting them to Long Day for an additional 8 days. Shoot apices were dissected at either d0 or d8 in long days. Two biological replicates were performed. The following genotypes were used:

Col - wild type arabidopsis; reference strain

LFY (lfy12; LFY::AthLFY) - Arabidopsis

UNI (lfy12; LFY::UNI) - Pisum

ALF (lfy12; LFY::ALF) - Petunia

WelNDLY (lfy12; LFY::WelNDLY) - Welwitschia mirabilis

CrLFY1 (lfy12; LFY::CrLFY1) - Ceratopteris richardii

CrLFY2 (lfy12; LFY::CrLFY2) - Ceratopteris richardii

lfy-2; weak lfy allele

lfy-9; intermediate leafy allele

lfy-12; strong leafy allele.

bibliography.title: The floral regulator LEAFY evolves by substitutions in the DNA binding domain.
